item.text: On that day the book of Moses was read aloud in the hearing of the people. They found written in it that no Ammonite or Moabite may ever enter the assembly of God,

<st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> they had <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="06923" class="">met</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> with <st data-num="03899" class="">food</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>, but instead had <st data-num="07936 05921">hired</st> <st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st> to <st data-num="07043" class="">curse</st> them. (Our <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>, however, <st data-num="02015" class="">turned</st> the <st data-num="07045" class="">curse</st> into <st data-num="01293" class="">blessing</st>.)
When they heard the law, they removed from Israel all who were of mixed ancestry.
But before this time, Eliashib the priest, a relative of Tobiah, had been appointed over the storerooms of the temple of our God.

He made for him a large storeroom where previously they had been keeping the grain offering, the incense, and the vessels, along with the tithes of the grain, the new wine, and the olive oil as commanded for the Levites, the singers, the gatekeepers, and the offering for the priests.
During all this time I was not in Jerusalem, for in the thirty-second year of King Artaxerxes of Babylon, I had gone back to the king. After some time I had requested leave of the king,

and I <st data-num="0935" class="">returned</st> to <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>. Then I <st data-num="0995" class="">discovered</st> the <st data-num="07451" class="">evil</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0475" class="">Eliashib</st> had <st data-num="06213" class="">done</st> for <st data-num="02900" class="">Tobiah</st> by <st data-num="06213" class="">supplying</st> him with a <st data-num="05393" class="">storeroom</st> in the <st data-num="02691" class="">courts</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> of <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>.

I <st data-num="07489" class="">was</st> <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="07489" class="">upset</st>, and I <st data-num="07993" class="">threw</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> of <st data-num="02900" class="">Tobiah’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">household</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">possessions</st> <st data-num="02351" class="">out</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="03957" class="">storeroom</st>.
Then I gave instructions that the storerooms should be purified, and I brought back the equipment of the temple of God, along with the grain offering and the incense.
I also discovered that the portions for the Levites had not been provided, and that as a result the Levites and the singers who performed this work had all gone off to their fields.
So I registered a complaint with the leaders, asking, “Why is the temple of God neglected?” Then I gathered them and reassigned them to their positions.
Then all of Judah brought the tithe of the grain, the new wine, and the olive oil to the storerooms.

I gave instructions that Shelemiah the priest, Zadok the scribe, and a certain Levite named Pedaiah be put in charge of the storerooms, and that Hanan son of Zaccur, the son of Mattaniah, be their assistant, for they were regarded as trustworthy. It was then their responsibility to oversee the distribution to their colleagues.
Please remember me for this, O my God, and do not wipe out the kindness that I have done for the temple of my God and for its services!

In those days I saw people in Judah treading winepresses on the Sabbath, bringing in heaps of grain and loading them onto donkeys, along with wine, grapes, figs, and all kinds of loads, and bringing them to Jerusalem on the Sabbath day. So I warned them on the day that they sold these provisions.

The <st data-num="06876" class="">people from Tyre</st><n id="1" /> who <st data-num="03427" class="">lived</st> there were <st data-num="0935" class="">bringing</st> <st data-num="01709" class="">fish</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all kinds of</st> <st data-num="04377" class="">merchandise</st> and were <st data-num="04376" class="">selling</st> it on the <st data-num="07676" class="">Sabbath</st> to the <st data-num="01121" class="">people</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>—and in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>, of all places!<n id="2" />

So I <st data-num="07378" class="">registered a complaint</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="02715" class="">nobles</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>, <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st> to them, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> is <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">evil</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">thing</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> are <st data-num="06213" class="">doing</st>, <st data-num="02490" class="">profaning</st> the <st data-num="07676" class="">Sabbath</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>?
Isn’t this the way your ancestors acted, causing our God to bring on them and on this city all this misfortune? And now you are causing even more wrath on Israel, profaning the Sabbath like this!”

When the evening shadows began to fall on the gates of Jerusalem before the Sabbath, I ordered the doors to be closed. I further directed that they were not to be opened until after the Sabbath. I positioned some of my young men at the gates so that no load could enter on the Sabbath day.

The <st data-num="07402" class="">traders</st> and <st data-num="04376" class="">sellers</st> of <st data-num="03605" class="">all kinds of</st> <st data-num="04465" class="">merchandise</st> <st data-num="03885" class="">spent the night</st> <st data-num="02351" class="">outside</st> <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> <st data-num="06471" class="">once</st> or <st data-num="08147" class="">twice</st>.

But I <st data-num="05749" class="">warned</st> them and <st data-num="0559 0413">said</st>,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="04069" class="">Why</st> do <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="03885" class="">spend the night</st> <st data-num="05048" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="02346" class="">wall</st>? <st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> you <st data-num="08138" class="">repeat</st> this, I will <st data-num="03027" class="">forcibly</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">remove</st> you!”<n id="2" /> <st data-num="04480" class="">From</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="06256" class="">time</st> on they did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">show up</st> on the <st data-num="07676" class="">Sabbath</st>.<n id="3" />

Then I directed the Levites to purify themselves and come and guard the gates in order to keep the Sabbath day holy.

For this please remember me, O my God, and have pity on me in keeping with your great love.
Also in those days I saw the men of Judah who had married women from Ashdod, Ammon, and Moab.

<st data-num="02677" class="">Half</st> their <st data-num="01121" class="">children</st> <st data-num="01696" class="">spoke</st> the <st data-num="0797" class="">language of Ashdod</st> (or the <st data-num="03956" class="">language</st> of <st data-num="05971" class="">one</st> of the other <st data-num="05971" class="">peoples</st> mentioned<n id="1" />) and <st data-num="0369 05234">were unable</st> to <st data-num="01696" class="">speak</st> the <st data-num="03066" class="">language of Judah</st>.

So I <st data-num="07378" class="">entered a complaint</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> them. I <st data-num="07043" class="">called down a curse on</st> them, and I <st data-num="05221" class="">struck</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">some</st> of the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> and <st data-num="04803" class="">pulled out</st> their <st data-num="04803" class="">hair</st>. I had them <st data-num="07650" class="">swear</st> by <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> saying, “You will <st data-num="0518" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">marry off</st><n id="1" /> your <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st> to their <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>, and you will <st data-num="0518" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05375" class="">take</st> any of their <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st> <st data-num="05375" class="">as wives</st> for your <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> or for yourselves.

Was it <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">because of</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">things</st> like <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> that <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="02398" class="">sinned</st>? Among the <st data-num="07227" class="">many</st> <st data-num="01471" class="">nations</st> there <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="03644" class="">like</st> him. He <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="0157" class="">loved</st> by his <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>, and <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">made</st><n id="1" /> him <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>. But the <st data-num="05237" class="">foreign</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wives</st> made <st data-num="01571" class="">even</st> him <st data-num="02398" class="">sin</st>!
Should we then in your case hear that you do all this great evil, thereby being unfaithful to our God by marrying foreign wives?”
Now one of the sons of Joiada son of Eliashib the high priest was a son-in-law of Sanballat the Horonite. So I banished him from my sight.
Please remember them, O my God, because they have defiled the priesthood, the covenant of the priesthood, and the Levites.
So I purified them of everything foreign, and I assigned specific duties to the priests and the Levites.

I also provided for the wood offering at the appointed times and also for the firstfruits.

Please remember me for good, O my God.
